text: Hôtel Alexandre also known as Hôtel Soult is a hôtel particulier in the 8th arrondissement of Paris, France designed by French architect Étienne-Louis Boullée. The building was constructed from 1763 to 1766 and is the best surviving structure designed by Boullée. == History == === Construction === The hôtel particulier was commissioned by André-Claude-Nicolas Alexandre, a French financer. Boullée began designing the building at age 35, making it one of his earliest projects. A mansard roof was later adder to the building, replacing the original rooftop terrace. === Heritage designation === The building was listed as a Monument historique on November 4, 1927. === 2001 addition === The building as seen through doorway of the 2001 addition In 2001 the building was incorporated into the atrium of a contemporary office building designed by Delaage Tsiropoulos Architecture Carvunis Cholet to serve as the headquarters of Suez. == Gallery == File:Hotel Alexandre.jpg|Boullée's drawing of Hotel Alexandre File:Pavillon 16 Rue Ville L’Eveque (8e) (3702079410).jpg|1909 photograph of the building by Eugène Atget File:Hôtel Alexandre 1.jpg|Detail of the building's facade == References == Category:Buildings and structures in the 8th arrondissement of Paris Category:Hôtels particuliers in Paris Category:Monuments historiques in Paris
title: Hôtel Alexandre
